title: Bahasa Indonesia Islamic love letter templates and letter defaults

requirements.summary: Translate all Islamic love letter templates (titles and bodies) to natural, respectful Bahasa Indonesia while preserving Islamic references and citations.
acceptanceCriteria: All entries in `islamicLetterTemplates` have Indonesian `title` and Indonesian `content` text (no remaining English sentences in the template bodies).
Quran/hadith references remain present and correctly cited (e.g., Surah/ayah references like Quran 30:21, 2:187 are still included).
Selecting any template in the UI loads the Indonesian content into the letter editor and preview as expected.

file_operations.description: Rewrite each template `title` and `content` in Bahasa Indonesia, ensuring the language is natural and adab-respecting; preserve Islamic phrases (e.g., Bismillah) and keep Quran/hadith citations (e.g., Quran 30:21, Quran 2:187) intact.

requirements.summary: Update the Letter section fallback text, placeholders, and sign-off line to Bahasa Indonesia for a consistently Indonesian letter experience before template selection.
acceptanceCriteria: When `fromName` is empty, the displayed sender fallback is in Indonesian.
When `letterText` is empty, the preview shows an Indonesian fallback prompt instead of English.
The textarea placeholder text is Indonesian.
The sign-off line (currently “With love,”) is Indonesian.

file_operations.description: Update the `displayFrom` fallback string, `finalLetterText` fallback string, the Textarea `placeholder`, and the preview sign-off line text to Bahasa Indonesia while keeping the existing single-page flow, template selection behavior, and editable letter behavior unchanged.
